value.title: NVIDIA Launches New RTX A2000 GPU With 6GB GDDR6 ECC Memory
value.excerpt: NVIDIA officially launched the RTX A2000, a compact GPU designed for professionals, designed to fit into small form factor desktop PCs. Built upon the GPU brand’s current Ampere architecture, the card was built to handle a wide variety of professional tasks by accelerating AI and ray-tracing in workflows.

value.title: Run:AI Achieves Red Hat Certification for OpenShift
value.excerpt: AI, creator of the first cloud-native compute orchestration platform for AI, announced today the completion of certification for their Red Hat OpenShift Operator. The certification enables companies using Graphics Processing Units (GPUs) on OpenShift-managed Kubernetes clusters to more quickly and simply install Run:AI's software.

value.title: Intel expands AI career education program to 18 community colleges

value.title: Upcoming Pixel 6 and 6 Pro will run Google's own AI-focused Tensor chip
value.excerpt: Google's Pixel 5 smartphone was surprisingly unambitious, an affordable mid-ranger rather than a high-end flagship, prompting some to ask if the company was quietly planning to step back from manufacturing its own Android handsets.

value.title: Google equips Pixel 6 with its own chip to exploit AI to the max
value.excerpt: For the first time, Google will outfit its new Pixel 6 smartphone with a chip manufactured by the company and designed specifically to exploit artificial intelligence to the maximum degree possible, above all in the areas of photography and voice recognition.

value.title: OpenAI debuts Python-based Triton for GPU-powered machine learning
value.excerpt: OpenAI, the nonprofit venture whose professed mission is the ethical advancement of artificial intelligence (AI), has released the first version of the Triton language, an open source project that allows researchers to write GPU-powered deep learning projects without needing to know the intricacies of GPU programming for machine learning.

value.title: Nvidia is tracking more than 8,500 AI startups with $60B in funding
value.excerpt: Nvidia is tracking more than 8,500 AI startups through its Inception AI startup program. Those companies have raised more than $60 billion.
